title: Warning
text: Stay away!  Absolutely the worst app ever!  Impossible to navigate, constant freezing and beyond frustrating.  Hello Cox, did anyone actually evaluate and USE this app before releasing to general public?  Extremely doubtful!Stay away unless this is the only option to watch programming in your home.

title: By Far The Worst Abomination Of An App Ever
text: This is absolutely the buggiest app I have ever used. It never works, it's laid out ridiculously, and completely worthless.  It will have you screaming at your iPad and banging it on your forehead.As a previous reviewer said , Cox couldn't have tested this... or like always they just don't care.

title: Useless
text: This app goes out of its way to disable any functionality for jailbroken devices. It's completely useless! I wish I could go less than 1 star for this complete waste of space.

title: Disappointed
text: Wish I could give this app a negative rating because that is what it deserves. Freezes during start more often than it works. When I actually am able to watch a show the video freezes or the screen just locks up forcing a close/restart process. If this is the best Cox can do then it's probably time to look into changing cable/internet providers.

title: Update: Seems to be working again. Fantastic when it doesn't think I'm not home when I really am.
text: Sadder than homeless kittens in a tin can and one has an eye patch.It used to be pretty nice. I could watch good tv on the ipad while others watched junk on the tv. Now I can't watch anything on the ipad because it thinks I'm not at home. Network rebooting and reinstalls do nothing to jog it back to reality. However, I can still use the "send to tv" option with no issues which is not very useful because I'm sitting at home in the first place.6 Jun 2014 update applied. Failed to fix problem. Removed and reinstalled from scratch, kittens are still sad.25 Jul update: something made it work again yippie!

title: This is a Terrible App…
text: This app has a terrible UI. Its beautiful to look at if you don't need to do anything with it. I'm sure Cox thinks its great. All most people want to know is "WHAT'S ON TV?" I don't care about genres. How about a simple list from top to bottom of the channels you pump into my home? How about making that list easy to find and simple to read? Hell, I'd settle for a web site but the Cox site which has such a list doesn't work half the time. Cable television is becoming more and more obsolete. I would think Cox would write apps that help their customers use their products instead of frustrate them.

title: Confusing UI, won't play any shows
text: The user interface is not intuitive.  I don't like how it works.  It’s also SLOW to respond.I can get the TV guide, but nothing will play.  I click on the play triangle when viewing the details of a show and the screen goes black.  That's it.

title: No longer working
text: Mine was working ok until 6/23 except that every week or so I will receive an error message and would have to delete the app and renown load it. Yesterday I had to download the app again. Now it won't open and I can't remove it either because the icon is not showing but in the setting it shows the app is downloading. Help!!!!!

title: Pretty but unusable
text: This app has some nice graphics and transitions, but it should have been designed to be usable. For one thing, the search doesn't work. If you are looking for a program titled "Rosy Day" and you paste the entire title in, rather than Rosy Day being the first option, The Last of the Mohicans is shown first, and the show Rosy Day isn't listed without scrolling really far right. If instead you only enter "rosy" you will get the desired Rosy Day (92618 market on June 23, 2014). It looks like they're doing an "or" search on any words without any priority on all entered words let alone those in the same order and proximity.Also there's no apparent way to quickly jump to a channel or time which I was hoping would at least be improved from their Cox Connect app, which is all buggy but at least doesn't make you scroll through all the channels to get to where you want to go.Using Cox apps makes me wish I had Comcast again (not available in my current market) to at least have apps that are usable.Before you release another app, try them out on your highest-level executive who is the least computer/mobile knowledgable unless you're afraid of getting fired.

title: Not a great app...
text: It seems that this app freezes up and buffers too much. I can watch Netflix or Amazon Prime Videos, but when I pull up the Cox app I get so frustrated that I just give up. It works reliably less than 50% of the time. Also, if I can only connect in my house, then why not give the local channels too? I guess one thing at a time, fix the app first, then give us the channels.
